intro: Thrixspermum platyphyllum, commonly known as the flat-leaf thrixspermum, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive flat, broad structure, and its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbrella-like formations. Thrixspermum platyphyllum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and fragrant properties. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and botanical research.
